channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for KY
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for KY

item.title: Report E-2024070451
item.description:
Report E-2024070451

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-19T18:15:23+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-15
  • City: LEXINGTON
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed approximately two (2) gallons of material released from two (2) 5-gallon metal jerrycans. The released material impacted the trailer floor and Dayton Freight personnel deployed granular absorbents to the impacted area. The spent absorbents were recovered and containerized into one (1) 10-gallon poly drum. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freightâ€™s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

item.title: Report X-2024071140
item.description:
Report X-2024071140

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-18T15:13:38+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-07
  • City: LOUISVILLE
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: AIR PACKAGE FROM GERMANY TO THE USA WAS BEING INSPECTED BY USA CBP OFFICIALS WHO DISCOVERED UNDECLARED DANGEROUS GOODS. UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS DISCOVERED EIGHT BOOKS OF SAFETY MATCHES, FOUR AMICHAUF HEATING KITS CONTAINING SIX COMBUSTIBLE DRY FUEL TABLETS AND ELEVEN ADDITIONAL COMBUSTIBLE DRY FUEL TABLETS. THE COMBUSTIBLE DRY FUEL TABLES ARE REGULATED AS UN1328, HEXAMETHYLENETETRAMINE, 4.1, PG III. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOX.

item.title: Report E-2024070272
item.description:
Report E-2024070272

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-15T18:15:54+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-05
  • City: FORT THOMAS
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On July 5, 2024, eight (8) 5-gallon pails of UN1490 were dropped during loading and released approximately fifty (50) pounds of product to the pavement. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Thin Line Environmental (TLE) to remediate the impacted site. TLE utilized hand tools and a HEPA vacuum to recover the released product. All damaged pails and impacted debris were collected and containerized into three (3) 35-gallon vented poly drums and one (1) 55-gallon vented poly drum
